body:
> Could you post `WAYLAND_DEBUG=1 alacritty --print-events` log?

Already included in the report.

Ah, sorry, haven't noticed that it was _attached_.

This should fix it

```diff
diff --git a/alacritty/Cargo.toml b/alacritty/Cargo.toml
index d0d6ab35..40c678fd 100644
--- a/alacritty/Cargo.toml
+++ b/alacritty/Cargo.toml
@@ -39,7 +39,7 @@ serde_json = "1"
 serde_yaml = "0.9.25"
 toml = "0.8.2"
 unicode-width = "0.1"
-winit = { version = "0.29.8", default-features = false, features = ["rwh_05", "serde"] }
+winit = { git = "https://github.com/kchibisov/winit", rev = "ff70ff3906926b05106894e95c7c3b67d514c4de", default-features = false, features = ["rwh_05", "serde"] }

 [build-dependencies]
 gl_generator = "0.14.0"

```

> This should fix it

:+1:, can confirm that it works with the winit patch.

issue.title: On Wayland, issue resize due to scale change

repository.name: winit
repository.description: Window handling library in pure Rust

issue.body:
This is a regression from 8f6de4ef.

Links: https://github.com/alacritty/alacritty/issues/7559

- [x] Tested on all platforms changed
- [x] Added an entry to `CHANGELOG.md` if knowledge of this change could be valuable to users

issue.title: GUI crashes with `buffer not divisible by scale (2)`
issue.body:
When scaling is used (in my case 2) under wayland GUI crashes with:
```
$ RUST_BACKTRACE=1 amdgpu_top --gui
wl_surface@24: error 2: Buffer size (359x465) is not divisible by scale (2)
Protocol error 2 on object wl_surface@24: 
Protocol error 2 on object wl_surface@24: 
Protocol error 2 on object wl_surface@24: 
Failed to set up a graphics context (OpenGL).
winit EventLoopError: Exit Failure: 1
thread 'main' panicked at crates/amdgpu_top_gui/src/lib.rs:274:9:
explicit panic
stack backtrace:
note: Some details are omitted, run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=full` for a verbose backtrace.
```
`--list` output:
```
$ amdgpu_top --list
amdgpu_top v0.7.0

#0:
    AMD Radeon Graphics (0x15BF.0xC4)
    DevicePath { render: "/dev/dri/renderD128", card: "/dev/dri/card1", pci: "0000:c1:00.0" }
```
Window manager is Sway. If scaling is set to 1 it starts fine.
